definition: dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds used in medicine)
dodder (Cuscuta sinensis, a parasitic vine with seeds having medicinal uses)/also called 菟絲子|菟丝子
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Soybean Dodder is one of the popular and quarantined diseases threatening the soybean production.
sentences.chinese: 大豆菟丝子是大豆生产上常见的病害，为检疫性病害。

sentences.english: So we consider Glyphosate as the finest chemicals in controlling C. europaea.
sentences.chinese: 因此，我们认为是目前防治菟丝子的最佳药物。

sentences.english: Cuscuta spp have wide ranges of host.
sentences.chinese: 菟丝子属植物的寄主广泛。

sentences.english: These findings suggested that the developement and utilization of resources of Cuscuta japonica be available.
sentences.chinese: 作者认为开发利用大菟丝子资源有着广阔前景。

sentences.english: The experimental results provide a scientific basis the rational use of Semen Cuscutae.
sentences.chinese: 实验结果为合理使用菟丝子类生药提供了科学依据。

sentences.english: But dodder’s sniffing skills can be turned against it.
sentences.chinese: 反过来，可以利用菟丝子的闻味技能来对付其本身。

sentences.english: The dodder weed may look stringy and small, but don’t let that trick you.
sentences.chinese: 菟丝子看起来纤细而弱小，但不要被其外观所欺骗。

sentences.english: Dodder can reduce agricultural productivity and can render a seed crop unmarketable.
sentences.chinese: 菟丝子会使农业减产，还会使种子作物滞销。

definition: Epimedium, genus of herbaceous flowering plant, cultivated in the Far East as aphrodisiac/also called barrenwort or horny goatweed (said to resemble crushed goat's testicles)
golden eye-grass (Curculigo orchioides)/Curculigo rhizome (used in TCM)
Achyranthes bidentata (root used in Chinese medicine)
eucommia (a kind of rubber tree)
common water plantain (Alisma plantago-aquatica)/water plantain rhizome (used in TCM)
schizandra (Schisandra chinensis)/Magnolia vine
Angelica sinensis
root bark of the peony tree (used in TCM)
huangqi/milk vetch root (used in TCM)/Astragalus membranaceus or Astragalus mongholicus
King Solomon's seal (plant of genus Polygonatum)
Ningpo figwort (Scrophularia ningpoensis)/root of Ningpo figwort (used in TCM)
Wolfiporia extensa (a wood-decay fungus)/fu ling/tuckahoe
dwarf lilyturf (Ophiopogon japonicus), its tuber used in TCM
ladybell root (Radix adenophorae)
chuanxiong rhizome
goji berry
